description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5k93s","text":"This is a step-by-step guide for preparing agar microchambers using a patterned stamp. The protocol includes detailed instructions on selecting the appropriate stamp, preparing the setup, centrifuging the agar into the stamp, and mounting cells of interest for live imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation: Avasthi P, Essock-Burns T, Garcia III G, Gehring J, Matus DQ, Mets DG, York R. (2023). Gotta catch ‘em all: Agar microchambers for high-throughput single-cell live imaging. https://doi.org/10.57844/arcadia-v1bg-6b60
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"3qar8","text":"Silicone stamp (opaque PDMS) from https://researchmicrostamps.com/","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"acd69","text":"Noble agar - Thermo scientific CAS 9002-18-0","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e51n9","text":"TAP medium - UTEX Media","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8gdh","text":"Six-well plate - VWR Cat# 10062-892","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvd99","text":"Glass slides (75 × 25 mm) - Corning 2947","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"i238","text":"#1.5 square coverslips (22.5 × 22.5 mm) - Electron Microscopy Sciences (EMS) Cat# 72204-01","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejmqq","text":"VALAP made from equal parts:","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5at9t","text":"Vasoline - Sigma-Aldrich 16415","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cl52","text":"Lanolin - Sigma-Aldrich L7387","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40qfb","text":"Paraffin wax - Sigma-Aldrich 76242","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgf36","text":"Microcentrifuge tube (1.5 mL) - VWR #20170-038","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"89lmf","text":"Small paint brush - Crayola 53516","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hci2","text":"Forceps - EMS 78317-2","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1q3ml","text":"Lab tape - VWR #89087-920","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1l828","text":"Nitrile gloves - Halyard Ref 55082","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cu697","text":"Heat block - Benchmark BSH 1001","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1cs4l","text":"Metal piece of a heat block removed used as a weight","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"atgcc","text":"Pipette and tips to transfer sample - Rainin","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9cbng","text":"Razor blade - Bates Choice Pro","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekp3s","text":"Plastic transfer pipette - HEA206373A","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qjpl","text":"Kimwipe - Kimtech 34155","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d65gs","text":"Centrifuge - Sorvall X Pro Series X1R Pro-MD","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qrtu","text":"Insert for plate - Thermo Scientific 75003624","type":"align-left","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"esp0c","text":"Familiarize yourself with the protocol and make sure to click the appropriate tab based on whether this is your first time doing this, a subsequent time, or your first time using a new stamp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: First time preparing microchambers
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ftbbq","text":"Use these instructions the first time you run this protocol or when you need to prepare the slide setup and aliquots of agar. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Subsequent times doing this protocol
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5tciv","text":"This abbreviated protocol assumes you've prepared all materials beforehand. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: First time using a new stamp
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"36bgb","text":"The first time you use a new stamp, you may need centrifugation to get the agar between the protrusions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a079","text":"Stack four glass slides and bind each end of the stack with a single layer of lab tape. You will need two bound stacks of four to make one agar pad. If you are making two agar pads at once, you will need four slide stacks total.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2f1f1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajep2","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6vteg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cuctr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F0324F30E93911EDA60B67AB78963A0B","height":175.87272727272742,"id":368602,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7oadn","text":"Two stacks of four slides each, bound by a single layer of lab tape.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"k5ddb2m87.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh86bx3af.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh84bx3af.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh85bx3af.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh83bx3af.webp","width":254.5526315789477}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"632ci","text":"If the agar pad ends up being too thick, try using slide stacks with only three slides.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"360k8","text":"Review the workflow below. We refer back to this diagram a few times throughout the protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20lg4","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C9DF9570E91D11EDB97C199192FCD393","height":372,"id":368606,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":11,"offset":27}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6f5hb","text":"This figure comes from the publication linked to this protocol. For your first time using a new stamp, see the \"New Stamp\" protocol that includes the centrifugation step.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"CEA90534E91D11EDA7CD0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://research.arcadiascience.com/pub/resource-agar-microchambers"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Fig3-Process-diagram.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9abx3af.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh88bx3af.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh89bx3af.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh87bx3af.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"brrt0","text":"Purchase a stamp from researchmicrostamps.com (or equivalent) with protrusions in the desired dimensions. See Figure 9 in our main publication to estimate the appropriate size.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":23},{"key":1,"offset":131,"length":11},{"key":2,"offset":177,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cjg28","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fr8fk","text":"Once you have the stamp, make sure you can tell which side has the protrusions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F9B342CDCD9811ED966A0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://researchmicrostamps.com"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"30030250E89811EDB97C199192FCD393","url":"https://research.arcadiascience.com/pub/resource-agar-microchambers"}},"2":{"type":"cost","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F9B34327CD9811ED966A0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"url":"http://researchmicrostamps.com","value":"$200–300"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"617jc","text":"Wash the stamp with 70% ethanol in deionized (DI) water and allow to air-dry completely. You can dry in a one-well plate to minimize dust. If small fibers or dust remain on the stamp, try using an air blower/duster.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ellt8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7f38j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q7jk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5fm3j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c1emr","text":"When not in use, store the stamp in a plastic case to keep it from collecting dust.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"33eg9","text":"Wash the stamp with 70% ethanol in deionized (DI) water and allow to air-dry completely. You can dry in a one-well plate to minimize dust. If small fibers or dust remain on the stamp, try using an air blower/duster.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7f7nh","text":"Place a single glass slide on a flat surface lined by each stack of slides (from step 5). This will become the \"stamp slide\" coded in teal in panel B in our overview figure from step 2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7abg0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6kkep","text":"   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"apuf5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6cukc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"35E8C800D7D411EDA7E4937330F4A7B4","height":201.0654545454544,"id":368610,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5irif","text":"Slide setup with the stamp facing up.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Stamp slide setup before agar@4x.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9eb2m87.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9cb2m87.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9db2m87.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9bb2m87.webp","width":215.14785992217884}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ar7vl","text":"If you are making more than one set of agar microchambers at a time, label the corners of the slides to keep track of each stamp type. If you cannot tell which side of the stamp the protrusions are on, use a stereo microscope to check. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eh8ns","text":"Use a heat block set to    to melt an aliquot of agar and then transfer to another heat lock set to   to maintain as a liquid and ensure that no bubbles are in the agar. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":100,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5iu8f","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7t2jq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"20E7F1D0CD9B11EDAD6D317F92586748","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"100","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"328A9000CD9B11EDAD6D317F92586748","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"70","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4F0F2150CD9B11EDAD6D317F92586748","height":309,"id":368614,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e5ok","text":"Melting an aliquot of 5% agar in a culture tube.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"culture tubes 100 70.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9ib2m87.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9gb2m87.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9hb2m87.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9fb2m87.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f6n9v","text":"Make up 5% agar in the appropriate medium (for more detail see 6.1).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eami3","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4m0l","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fob6e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ciq1j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"86F38B50CDA111EDAD6D317F92586748","height":255.26909090909123,"id":368618,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d2an7","text":"5% Noble agar solution. The clear portion is liquified. The translucent portion is material that we hardened in the six-well plate and then added back to the bottle for reuse. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"agar bottle v2.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9nb2m87.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9kb2m87.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9mb2m87.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9jb2m87.webp","width":191.53888130968642}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":1,"offset":33,"style":"bold"},{"length":14,"offset":146,"style":"italic"},{"length":1,"offset":165,"style":"italic"}],"key":"dq205","text":"We used Noble agar and TAP medium (2.5 g noble agar in 50 mL tris-acetate-phosphate). Noble agar is clear and TAP medium is optimal for observing Chlamydomonas cells in their vegetative state. You can substitute other types of agar and different media or water more appropriate for other organisms. Adjust the percentage of agar if the stamp does not form uniform protrusions into the agar bed.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45rij","text":"To make up 5% agar in a solution, first tare a balance with the weigh boat or paper you will use. Then measure 2.5 g of Noble agar and transfer to a glass container (large enough to hold the volume needed with room for the agar to boil and short enough to fit into the microwave). Add 50 mL of water or medium to the jar. Microwave in 30 s intervals until you see bubbling. Gently swirl the bottle to make sure the agar is fully dissolved. Be careful not to overheat and spill the solution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ajci","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9shom","text":"In the photo in step 6, we show 50 mL of agar in a 250 mL glass jar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"445bv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8sabq","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a4an8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"safety","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8l7qc","text":"Make sure the cap is only loosely screwed onto the bottle while microwaving the solution. Handle the hot bottle with protective gloves and remove from the microwave slowly.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ej69h","text":"Follow the \"First time\" protocol through step 7 and then proceed with the following steps for centrifugation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"epq5b","text":"Pour warm agar over the stamp, covering it completely within the well. Then cover the plate and quickly transfer the plate to the centrifuge.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ascmj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6f8c0","text":" agar added to the well with the stamp.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"stamp with quickly.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"0C6F687CE89B11ED90B70A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"temperature"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"avaas","text":"Remove the slide stacks from both sides of the perpendicular slide sandwich.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ck1u7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"djp7r","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C8C6AED0CDA711EDAD6D317F92586748","height":153.0290909090909,"id":368626,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8ss9t","text":"A user removing the slide stacks.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"removing slides from sandwich cropped.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9wb2m87.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9ub2m87.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9vb2m87.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mh9tb2m87.webp","width":214.16284987277368}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"109ah","text":"Place the melted agar into a bead bath or water bath set to   for   or until the bubbles dissipate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":66,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"25id9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7BC89660CDA311EDAD6D317F92586748","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":180,"guid":"45E130B0CDA411EDAD6D317F92586748","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"336ap","text":"Use a razor blade to gently pry the bottom slide off of the sandwich.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51bj0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5pk9","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4ingf","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8g8gr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C52109F0CDA811EDAD6D317F92586748","height":226.9018181818182,"id":368642,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1051p","text":"Prying the stamp slide from the agar sandwich.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"prying sandwich.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/miaeb2m87.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/miacb2m87.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/miadb2m87.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/miabb2m87.webp","width":216.28422876949736}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"5ia9u","text":"It may be easier to flip the sandwich and remove this slide from the top. The goal is to separate the slide that had the stamp placed on it. This is the teal \"stamp slide\" from the diagram in step 2. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4ku4","text":"Use the razor blade to score (cut through the top, about halfway down) all four sides of agar along the edges of the stamp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91l9h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjstp","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3215CCD0CDA911EDAD6D317F92586748","height":124.32545454545472,"id":368646,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"eb720","text":"Scored agar prior to stamp removal.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"scored stamp before removal cropped.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/miaib2m87.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/miagb2m87.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/miahb2m87.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/miafb2m87.webp","width":222.73289902280155}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"43nck","text":"Once the agar is scored around all edges, you should be able to use forceps to gently peel off and discard or recycle the thin layer of agar on top of the stamp.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"861rv","text":"Use the forceps to gently dislodge the stamp without piercing the agar microchamber pad.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11fo9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"avck2","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AFCF9F20CDA911EDAD6D317F92586748","height":128.6581818181819,"id":368650,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9rfau","text":"A user lifting the stamp by holding one corner with forceps.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"stamp removal with forceps cropped.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mianb2m87.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/miakb2m87.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/miamb2m87.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/miajb2m87.webp","width":219.75776397515543}}}}

","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dfdmm","text":"Gently disassemble slide setup, remove the stamp, and trim excess agarose. Cut to divide the agar microchamber into four squares for four different treatments, if desired.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8q37b","text":"Prepare your cells or organisms of interest at the desired density. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amsts","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64kn0","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7k569","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bcprm","text":"Adjust the volume and concentration of cells or organisms as needed for your desired experiment (for example, choose whether you want a single cell per confined microchamber or several). Finding the right concentration may take a bit of trial and error — you can clean the microchambers by flushing with water or media and try again.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6c1j3","text":"Pipette 2–5 µL of cells or organisms onto the agar pad, spreading the liquid across to cover multiple you want to maximize the number of cells or organisms in wells, you can check them using a phase microscope and then try adding more culture, gently brushing the pipette to spread cells/organisms across the pad, and then using a Kimwipe to decrease the liquid volume by absorbing water at the edge of the pad.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":76,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aqcn1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8jm5f","text":" 1 mL aliquot of VALAP (marked V) in a heat block.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"valap aliquot 80C.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibeb2m87.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibcb2m87.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibdb2m87.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibbb2m87.webp","width":182.4320388349514}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"enul","text":"VALAP is made from a 1:1:1 mixture of vasoline:lanolin:paraffin. You can purchase vaseline from a drugstore, just be sure that it is unscented. You can melt equal parts of each ingredient, mix them together, aliquot, and store at room temperature for later use.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9fj34","text":"Once the ratio of cells/organisms in the wells is satisfactory, place a clean, square coverslip (#1.5 thickness) and seal with VALAP. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cghau","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vf8v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"544v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9p9lt","text":"VALAP will harden quickly once in contact with the slide at room temperature. Hold your slide close to the opened tube of VALAP on the heat block to keep it liquified and avoid dripping. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6jmdg","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"95qrd","text":"If you want to pipette media into the chamber just prior to sealing, leave an opening on either side of the agar pad. You can seal this opening with additional VALAP after flooding the chamber. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"arjgr","text":"Mount the slide onto the microscope stage and begin imaging.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cs9k2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9mi11","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"05F83AD0CE6B11EDAD4CEDCCB4AE1D83","height":171.2145454545452,"id":368678,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"auitr","text":"A slide with coverslip facing down on an inverted microscope.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"slide mounted on stage cropped.jpg","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibib2m87.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibgb2m87.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibhb2m87.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibfb2m87.webp","width":217.98148148148098}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2b0ka","text":"Pipette cells or organisms at the desired concentration onto the agar microchamber and seal with a coverslip if using an immersion objective.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"49g4f","text":"Place with the protrusions facing up into one well of a six-well plate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6djr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1141h","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7kr3j","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ftr6f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"405f0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AECBDCE0CF2C11EDAD4CEDCCB4AE1D83","height":164.65818181818184,"id":368682,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4ifhg","text":"Stamp sitting in six-well plate.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"stamp in 6 well plate.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibnb2m87.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibkb2m87.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibmb2m87.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibjb2m87.webp","width":219.8106796116505}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"frjji","text":"Set up a second plate with a second stamp to balance the centrifuge.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"371t7","text":"Spin the agar into the stamp  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7lj33","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i7o2","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"700","duration":180,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E0EF1930CF2C11EDAD4CEDCCB4AE1D83","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"37","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0E1CF490CF2D11EDAD4CEDCCB4AE1D83","height":222.08181818181797,"id":368686,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"36t8v","text":"A user inserts two six-well plates containing microstamps and agar into the centrifuge.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"stamp in centrifuge.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibsb2m87.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibqb2m87.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibrb2m87.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/mibpb2m87.webp","width":205.28571428571408}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1c2sp","text":"Use forceps or a metal scoop to lift the stamp with agar from the plate and place onto the slide setup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
